application.name: cathist
application.brief: Outputs the history of a cube
application.description: This program will output the full or brief history of a .cub file. The brief mode is especially useful for creating a script for a batch job, because the output is in the command line format.

history.change: Modified to output results in gui log if the gui is open

parameter.name: FROM
parameter.brief: Input file the history is needed from
parameter.description: The cube file the history is to be extracted from.

parameter.name: TO
parameter.description: This is the file which the PVL history for the input cube will go to.

parameter.name: APPEND
parameter.description: This option allows output to be appened to an already existing file. If this option is not checked and the file exists, it will be overwritten.

parameter.name: MODE
parameter.description: Different modes that cathist can run in.

option.description: Lists the full history of the file in the PVL format.
Lists a brief history of the file in a command line format.

example.description:
This example shows the cathist application in the full mode. This is the default mode.
Object = mirror IsisVersion = "3.0.2 beta | 2004-11-17" ProgramVersion = 2003-07-29 ExecutionDateTime = 2005-01-10T13:33:12 HostName = orkin UserName = eribelin Description = "Flip a cube from left-to-right"
Group = UserParameters FROM = peaks.cub TO = temp.cub End_Group End_Object
Object = circle IsisVersion = "3.0.2 beta | 2004-11-17" ProgramVersion = 2003-07-29 ExecutionDateTime = 2005-01-10T13:50:46 HostName = orkin UserName = eribelin Description = "Trims data outside of a circle"
Group = UserParameters FROM = temp.cub TO = temp2.cub End_Group End_Object End

terminalInterface.description: Run the cathist application on a .cub file.

This example shows the cathist application in the brief mode.
mirror from=peaks.cub to=temp.cub circle from=temp.cub to=temp2.cub
